titleStmt.author: Savile, John

analytic.title: To the right worshipfull master George Sauile, sonne and heire to Sir George Sauile knight, his most approued kinde patron; Health, honour, and happinesse.
analytic.author: Savile, John

monogr.title: King Iames his entertainment at Theobalds : vvith his welcome to London, together with a salutatorie poeme. By Iohn Sauile
monogr.author: Savile, John

div.head: To the right worshipfull master George Sauile, sonne and heire to Sir George Sauile knight, his most approued kinde patron; Health, honour, and happinesse.

lg.l: OF spring of Gentrie, sprig for honor drest,
Tis half your losse (ô hel) but al my blame
Jn proper words your worth should not b'exprest,
Let it suffice that I adore your name,
Then pardon what is wanting, I will owe it,
And as I'm able, J will pay I vow it.
Meane while accept this poeme, to our King sing
Peruse it at your leysure, halfe or all,
Your worships worth our Muse shall shortly
Though in true Poesie, her skills but small,
How ere it be, accept her pure good will,
She rests at your command, in all Saue-ill.

closer.signed: Your worships euer readie at command in all dutie, Iohn Sauile.
